title: FOIA Request -  Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy (XXXTENTACION)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FOIA Request -  Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy (XXXTENTACION)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All records within the your agency's possession, irrespective of timeframe, and with respect to this criteria and article referenced:
Information regarding Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy (known professionally as XXXTENTACION), Date of Birth: January 23rd, 1998 and the police presence on September 2nd, 2017 at a show in Tampa canceled due to an overcrowding risk at Ybor City's Orpheum.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Demarcus Nottington

title: FOIA Request - Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy (XXXTENTACION) (Broward County Sheriff)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All records within the possession of BROWARD COUNTY, irrespective of timeframe, and with respect to this criteria:
1. All records related to Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy , better known as XXXTENTACION (a rapper), related to his death on June 18, 2018 in Deerfield Beach, Florida.
2. All records related to Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy possessed by the County before his death (if any) as well as all records after his death.
3. All records related to Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy (known professionally as XXXTENTACION), Date of Birth: 23 January 1998, within your agency's possession from 2010 to present day.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Demarcus Nottington

title: Criminal Case History

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Criminal Case History
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Criminal cases history of an individual, Jason Kyle PACHECO (DOB. 3/11/1989) in Massachusetts. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. 

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Walker

communications.subject: Confirms Receipt
communications.communication:
Dear Public Records Request Submitter;

This message confirms receipt of your public records request by the Massachusetts Department of Criminal Justice Information Services (DCJIS).  The DCJIS will provide a formal response to your request for information as soon as possible.
Please note that the DCJIS may contact you with questions about your request or to clarify its scope.

In the interim, if you have any questions about the status of your request, please contact the DCJIS legal department at 617-660-4760 and ask to speak to Ms. Agapi Koulouris, the DCJIS General Counsel and Records Access Officer.

Thank you.

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

I have located this data at the following link: https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

However, the data at this link does not contain the full text of the initiative/referendum. In addition, it contains only information on elections dating back to 1986, while I request data for elections dating back to 1972.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

title: Data Request for Local ballot Initiatives/Referenda

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Data Request for Local ballot Initiatives/Referenda
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

I have located this data at the following link: https://data.texas.gov/Government-and-Taxes/Local-Debt-Bond-Election-Results/kbmc-qmvg/data 
However, the data at this link does not contain information on the text of the proposition and it contains only elections for local debt bond, while I request data for all local ballot initiatives/referenda.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Elections Division (Secretary of State))

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)


I have located a potential data source from your state at the following link: https://electionstats.state.ma.us/ballot_questions/search/year_from:1972/year_to:2022/type:is_local
However, the data at this link does not contain information on the election date or threshold above. In addition, it contains only information on elections after 2002, while I request data for elections since 1972.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Connecticut Secretary of State, Legislation and Elections Administration Division)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)


I have located a potential data source from your state at the following link: https://electionhistory.ct.gov/eng/ballot_questions/search/year_from:1845/year_to:2023/text:bond/ballot_question_type:Local%20Question
However, the data at this link does not contain information on election date or threshold. I am also wondering if this is the exhaustive list of local questions.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Florida Department of State - Division of Elections,  Bureau of Voter Registration Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

This website from California provides a good example of the type of data I am requesting:

https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han
